title: 3 Quick Ways to Save Instagram Highlights to Camera Roll

steps.title: Tap the profile icon.
steps.content: Tap the profile icon. It's the outline of a person at the bottom-right corner. This opens your profile. Your current Highlights appear below your bio near the top of the page. [1] X Research source You can use this method to save one of your Stories as a Highlight on your profile page.

steps.title: Tap the + New icon.
steps.content: Tap the + New icon. It's inside of a circle below your username and bio. This displays all of your archived Stories.

steps.title: Tap a Story to select it.
steps.content: Tap a Story to select it. You can also select multiple Stories by tapping on them. A blue checkmark appears in the top-right corner of the Story thumbnail to indicate it is selected.

steps.title: Tap Next.
steps.content: Tap Next . This is in the top-right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Type a name for your Highlights album (optional).
steps.content: Type a name for your Highlights album (optional). If you don't type anything, the default name is "Highlights".

steps.title: Edit the Highlights cover (optional).
steps.content: Edit the Highlights cover (optional). You can tap Edit cover to change the appearance of the cover image. You can move or crop the current cover or select a new image from your device's gallery. Tap Done when you're finished.

steps.title: Tap Add.
steps.content: Tap Add . You'll see this at the top-right corner. Your created Highlight will show under your username and bio. If you want to delete a Highlight, long-press the Highlight on your profile. Tap Delete highlight , and then Delete .

steps.title: Tap the profile icon.
steps.content: Tap the profile icon. It's the outline of a person at the bottom-right corner. This opens your profile. Your current Highlights appear below your bio near the top of the page. Since you can't directly download your Highlights, you must first convert it to a Reel and then download it.

steps.title: Long-press the Highlight you want to save.
steps.content: Long-press the Highlight you want to save. This will be underneath your bio. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Convert to reel.
steps.content: Tap Convert to reel . This is in the middle of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Skip.
steps.content: Tap Skip . This will skip any additional edits. If you want to add edits, add them now and tap Next . Once you skip, you'll see a preview of your Highlight turned Reel.

steps.title: Tap Next.
steps.content: Tap Next . This is the blue button at the bottom-right corner. The Share screen will open. If you don't want others to see your Highlight/Reel, tap Audience and set it to Close Friends . You can temporarily remove your current Close Friends and add them back later.

steps.title: Tap Share.
steps.content: Tap Share . This will post the Reel to your profile.

steps.title: Tap the Share button on the post.
steps.content: Tap the Share button on the post. This is the airplane button. The new Reel should be on your feed. Pull down the screen to refresh it if necessary. Alternatively, find your Reel on your profile. Tap the Reels tab, and then tap the Reel. Then, tap the airplane icon.

steps.title: Scroll to the far right and tap Download.
steps.content: Scroll to the far right and tap Download . This icon will be in the list of apps at the bottom of the Share menu. You'll need to tap and drag the first few apps towards the left to find it. The Highlight will be saved to your device's gallery. The Share menu may open automatically after it downloads; tap the X to close it or use it to send a copy of the Highlight file elsewhere. Repeat these steps for all other Highlights you want to save.

steps.title: Go to http://zasasa.com/en/download_instagram_stories.php in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to http://zasasa.com/en/download_instagram_stories.php in a web browser. This site will work on phones, tablets, and computers. You will need the full URL of the Instagram profile you want to download from. This method will not cover the steps to get Highlights from an Instagram account that's private.

steps.title: Type the full link to the Instagram profile you want to download from.
steps.content: Type the full link to the Instagram profile you want to download from. For example, you would type " https://www.instagram.com/nasa " to get all the stories from NASA.

steps.title: Check the box next to "Also download Highlights".
steps.content: Check the box next to "Also download Highlights". This is below the text field.

steps.title: Click Download.
steps.content: Click Download . If the Instagram account is public, you will see a list of all their Stories and Highlights. If the account is private, you'll see an error page instead. You can then use either option provided to download from that account. One option involves logging in to Instagram through this site. Logging in through the site puts your information at risk of being hacked, so proceed with caution.

steps.title: Choose a Story/Highlight to download.
steps.content: Choose a Story/Highlight to download. It will be highlighted.

steps.title: Select a video download size.
steps.content: Select a video download size. All videos, no matter the size, will download as an mp4. The selected video will open in a new tab.

steps.title: Tap and hold (or right-click) the image.
steps.content: Tap and hold (or right-click) the image. A menu will appear.

steps.title: Click or tap the download button.
steps.content: Click or tap the download button. This will vary on each device.
